newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada dollar ends stronger in heavy flows.
newsitem.headline: Canada dollar ends stronger in heavy flows.

text.p: * The Canadian dollar closed stronger in very heavy flows at C$1.3545 (US$0.7383) on Friday from Thursday's close of C$1.3593 (US$0.7357). * Rallies in North American equity and fixed income markets boosted unit. * Many fund managers becoming buyers, attracted by Canada's strong fundamentals.
* Range of C$1.3530-C$1.3565 seen in Asia late Sunday.
The Canadian dollar closed stronger in heavy dealings on Friday, spiking to strengths not seen in seven months on the back of rallies in North American equity and fixed income markets.
"Canada had a very good day, I guess," one dealer said. "Bonds have had a great week."
Canada's 30-year benchmark bond gained C$1.50 to C$106.75 to yield 7.414 percent on Friday. It gained about C$3.50 and dropped nearly 30 basis points in yield over the past week.
The Canadian dollar ended firmer at C$1.3545 (US$0.7383) on Friday from Thursday's close of C$1.3593 (US$0.7357).
The U.S. Federal Reserve is seen keeping short-term interest rates steady at least until the U.S. election on November 5, analysts said.
The Bank of Canada cut rates this week, dropping the bank rate to 4.0 percent from 4.25 percent, putting the bank rate now at the top of its new 3.5-4.0 percent target range.
On the crosses, the Canada dollar rose to 1.1302 marks from Thursday's close of 1.1258 marks and gained to hit 82.53 yen from 81.90 yen.
